title: Macron: What Netanyahu is doing in Gaza is 'unacceptable' and 'shameful'
summary: The French president answered questions from high-profile figures, union leaders, influencers and ordinary citizens on prime-time television on Tuesday to outline his plan for the rest of his term in office.

title: Trump says he will ease sanctions on Syria and move to restore relations with new leader
summary: The developments announced by Trump on Tuesday were a major boost for the Syrian president, who was previously imprisoned in Iraq for his role in the insurgency following the 2003 US-led invasion of the Arab country.

title: Menendez brothers resentenced over parents' 1989 murders, making parole now possible
summary: At an emotional hearing on Tuesday, family members had pleaded with Los Angeles Superior Court Judge Michael Jesic to open the path to the men's freedom, insisting they were changed. Supporters say they turned on abusive and controlling parents, who had subjected them to years of sexual and emotional abuse.

title: US debt: The rest of the world's bargaining tool against Donald Trump
summary: One-third of the US debt is held outside of the United States. This is significant enough that the Japanese finance minister has mentioned using this as leverage in trade negotiations.

title: Gérard Depardieu, sentenced for sexual assaults, 'does not seem to have grasped the concept of consent,' according to the Paris court
summary: An 18-month suspended sentence was handed down to the 76-year-old actor, judged for acts committed against two women in September 2021 during the filming of the movie 'Les Volets verts' ('The Green Shutters').

title: Aesthetic history of the vulva: From private anatomy to political icon
summary: Long perceived as unsettling, the female genital area has been subjected for millennia to more or less invasive acts aimed at shaping it for better control. Today, cosmetic surgery offers to beautify it. This remains a relatively taboo practice, while the vulva is otherwise seen as a feminist symbol.

title: Azerbaijan has imprisoned its last independent journalists
summary: Two journalists were arrested in early May and suffered abuse from the police. The annihilation of free media continues amid warming relations between the European Union and this gas-rich country.

title: Albania PM secures fourth term after large election win for the Socialist Party, officials confirm
summary: Edi Rama's Socialist Party won 52.1% of the vote on Sunday compared with 34.2% for an alliance of opposition parties led by his main rival Sali Berisha. According to projections, the Socialist Party could have more lawmakers than in the 2021 elections, when it won 74 seats in the 140-seat assembly.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs' ex Cassie says he forced her into 'disgusting' marathon group sex sessions
summary: Casandra Ventura, known as 'Cassie,' is heavily pregnant and will take regular breaks from her graphic testimony that could last several days. 'Sean controlled a lot of my life – whether it was [my] career, the way I dressed,' she told jurors on Tuesday. 'He would mash me in my head, knock me over, drag me, kick me, stomp me on the head if I was down,' she added, her voice shaking at points.

title: Beloved former Uruguayan President José Mujica has died at 89
summary: Uruguayan President Yamandú Orsi honored the  'president, activist, guide and leader' while announcing his death on Tuesday. During Mujica's 2010-2015 presidency, he oversaw the radical transformation of the small South American nation into one of the most socially liberal democracies, earning admiration at home and cult status abroad.

title: Zelensky calls on Trump to help him secure a meeting with Putin
summary: After Russian President Vladimir Putin suggested bilateral talks, Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelensky has pushed for direct talks in Turkey on Thursday, even urging the US to levy sanctions on Russia if Putin refuses to meet.

title: Cannes jury head Juliette Binoche pays tribute to Palestinian photojournalist at opening ceremony
summary: Palestinian photojournalist Fatima Hassouna was killed by an Israeli strike in April and is the subject of a documentary in competition at Cannes. Before Binoche's tribute, over 380 film figures accused Israel of 'genocide' in an open letter.

title: Kim Kardashian tells Paris court 'I thought I was going to die,' at robbery trial
summary: US TV star Kim Kardashian, who was held at gunpoint as masked men robbed her of millions of dollars of jewelry in her Paris hotel in October 2016, also told the court that she forgave one of the main defendants.

title: Saudia Arabia throws a decadent welcome for Trump, promising to invest billions in US weapons and AI
summary: On Tuesday, the Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman welcomed Trump with fighter jets and flag-waving cavalry, as the US President lavished praise on the kingdom: 'The transformation that has occurred under the leadership of King Salman and Crown Prince Mohammed has been truly extraordinary.'

title: Moratorium between China and the US ends trade war but fails to address underlying issues
summary: Financial markets welcomed the US-China agreement that ended the tariff escalation. But the two powers must still agree on the final level of customs duties, trade rebalancing and microprocessor exports.

title: South Africa attempts to restrict firearms use
summary: In a country with one of the highest homicide rates in the world, the government is seeking to limit firearm possession among private security company employees. Dysfunctional on multiple levels, the police services are overwhelmed.

title: Philippines: Mid-term general elections offer hope to the Duterte family
summary: The results showed the Duterte clan's resilience, despite their many legal woes, and the weakening of the Marcos family, as well as an unexpected surge by a third, progressive 'pink' bloc, heirs to the Aquino dynasty.

title: India-Pakistan: Narendra Modi adds fuel to the fire
summary: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has adopted a rather belligerent tone toward Pakistan. This was a way to reassure ultra-nationalists, who saw the conflict as an opportunity to reclaim the Pakistani-run part of Kashmir.
